DOCNAME: CASE OF IATROPOULOS AND OTHERS v. GREECE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 13+3 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy) (Article 3 - Prohibition of torture;Degrading treatment)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were all detained in ORG ( Τμήμα PERSON ) ; they were either in pre - trial detention or serving a prison sentence . CARDINAL . The applicants alleged that ORG had been an entirely inappropriate place in which to spend long periods of detention , as they had done . CARDINAL . Detainees had been confined to their cells and had not been allowed to spend time outside , which had affected their psychological health . Recreational activities had not been offered and cells had not been equipped with televisions or radio .

CARDINAL .
